prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has sides that are parallel to each other, with top and bottom faces that are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.7134, 0.4577] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with the following vertices: - (0.0, 0.0) - (0.1189, 0.0) - (0.1189, 0.1189) - (0.0, 0.1189) 4. Close the loop and complete the sketch. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1189. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 7. Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.2972 units in the positive Z direction. 8. Generate the solid model with 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' operation. Part 2: Construct a second three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This prism has sides that are parallel to each other, with top and bottom faces that are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 2 units by 3 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4161, 0.4577] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with the following vertices: - (0.0, 0.0) - (0.1189, 0.0) - (0.1189, 0.0594) - (0.0, 0.0594) 4. Close the loop and complete the sketch. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1189. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 7. Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.0594 units in the positive Z direction. 8. Generate the solid model with 'JoinFeatureOperation' operation.</description>
